ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-14T03:52:31 [Issue ID 4000-627049] urn:comicvine:4000-627049 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-18 21:35:31. [Issue ID 1761946]
ComicInfo.Summary:
*A GRIPPING STORY OF A YOUNG FOX’S STRUGGLE IN A HOSTILE WORLD!* When his mother is killed and his siblings taken by a farmer, Marney the fox cub finds himself left all alone in the beautiful yet deadly Devon countryside. From dodging blood-thirsty humans to encountering an array of wild animals, Marney must rely on all of his strength and cunning to survive.
This is a brilliantly constructed and complete story (collected here for the first time), showcasing the astonishing work of artist John Stokes and the glorious imagination of writer Scott Goodall.
https://comicvine.gamespot.com/marney-the-fox-1-hc/4000-627049/
ComicInfo.Title: “I owe you my life, young friend!”; “What the blue blazes happened?”; “Right, lads, look lively!”; “The ripple of water and the scent of moss!”; “A strange, strong smelling mist!”; “The air is still, but the ground shakes!”; “After him, Caleb!”; “I can see cages of wire!”; “Here in this place, I have become a prisoner!”; “The ancient human is trying to tame us!”; “Come, my beauties!”; “Sanctuary can be yours, little fox!”; “Ahead of me sits Longshanks the hare!”; “Sorry, old chap...”; “Even the food is not real!”; “Yesterday, young ones, you saved my life...”; “The wood gave way and I fell into the darkness!”; “Brave Marney does not move!”; “Marney! Help us!”; “Yaa-haar!”; “A sharp-bladed spade of hated man!”; “The noise of danger increases!”; “Our brother Nippet has gone, brave Marney!”; “A giant of a beast!”; “Four sleeping, helpless cubs!”; “Go now, and seek the great earth!”; “Haar! We've got 'em all right!”; “Hovering high above is Kaylor the Kestral!”; “Connelly, two big 'uns!”; “Harsh voices are raised in triumph!”; “A twig cracks!”; “The earth moves...”; “This time, Mr. Foxy is going to cop his lot!”; “A strong and fine mesh net!”; “Head rings and body aches!”; “Of the young human, there is no sign!”; “The blizzard worsens!”; “Thick metal bars my way out!”; “A terrible noise fills my ears!”; “The black hunter springs...”; “As the hours pass, the pain eases!”; “The ground is hard, and no birds sing!”; "The scents and sounds of hated man!"; “Ha, ha, ha! Ye're helpless now young foxy!”; “Hmmmm! The paper litter of hated man...”; “Narrdo the grouse has risen before dawn!”; “Nipper was the bravest ferret oi ever had!”; “Pinkeye, the ferret!”; “By crackey, how a fox got into the hold I'll never know!”; “Paws slide and fail to grip!”; “The eventide song of gathering swallows!”; “I tell you, the fox ain't there anymore, Major!”; “Once again, I am struck!”; “Eagle, sparrow-hawk, goshawk and falcon!”; “Bobbertail ducks and weaves in his effort to escape!”; “Danger strikes!”; “Right, men!”; “Blazing twigs and hurtling sparks!”; “'tis Feemor the pheasant and his family of young!”; “He's down!”; “The warning shriek of Mustak the stoat!”; “Move along now!”; “The cold light of dawn...”; “Blampton town be in the valley ahead of us, old mother!”; “One swift stroke will do it, Drango!”; “Good grief, what a shambles”; “Deadly blades whirl closer and closer!”; “In a thrush's nest...”; “The scent I seek now carries strongly upon the wind!”; “Darn it, they must have slipped past us...”; “The brat will be in here, somewhere!”; “No, sir, no!”; “Open this door, you snivelling brat!”; “Easy now... easy!”; “Pain grows worse!”; “One wall of the deep pit has caved in, Professor!”; “Look! The fox is entering the tunnel now, Professor!”; “It was a perfect shot!”; “Wind blows gently...”; “Nice piece of shootin', Jim!”; “Suction of the mud increases!”; “Here at last, we shall be safe...”; “I have stumbled upon Greytooth's lair!”; “He be makin' a run for it, Dad!”; “Paws are sunk in river-bed mud...”; “Waters are frozen!”; “The cold softness passes closer and closer!”; “A strange and frightening bird attacks me!”; “I hear a noise...”; “The scent of rain hangs thickly in the air!”; “Go orrrn me beauties!”; “Goliath still has the brute's scent, Colonel!”; “We have one, Colonel!”; “Here's health to you, landlord!”; “A few hours rest...”; “Bob, I thought I heard a thump on the roof of the car!”; “Coo, look!”; “A sweet scent upon the evening air!”; “The brute is moving pretty fast!”; “The hated scent is strong in my nostrils...”; “Limbs are cold and bones grow stiff!”; “Raaarrrnn!”; “Yuuu-aaowl!”; “The mountain moves!”; “Air... there is none...”; “Nagging hunger pains have been stilled at last!”; “The call of Turquo the kingfisher!”; “Metal jaws bite deep!”; “Storm dies!”; “The sun warm, the air soft!”
